name: SS Yongala
blurb: One of the world’s most legendary wreck dives, the Yongala teems with life—giant groupers, swirling trevally, sea snakes, and seasonal manta visitors. A massive intact hull resting on open sand gives it an eerie, cathedral-like presence.

name: Blue Corner
blurb: Hook in and fly! One of the planet’s most exhilarating wall dives, where ripping currents bring sharks, schools of jacks, and clouds of pyramid butterflies sweeping across the plateau.

name: Elphinstone Reef
blurb: A long, slender reef rising from the deep blue, known for thrilling oceanic whitetips, dramatic drop-offs, and soft coral terraces glowing under the sun.

name: Blue Hole
blurb: Notorious and iconic, the Blue Hole is a perfectly circular sinkhole plunging into shadowy cobalt darkness. The saddle route offers stunning coral and ambient light shafts.

name: Richelieu Rock
blurb: A horseshoe-shaped pinnacle bursting with macro life, swirling barracuda, and the occasional passing whale shark. Violet soft corals add surreal color along every nook.

name: USAT Liberty
blurb: A beautifully encrusted WWII cargo ship just meters from shore. Schools of bumpheads cruise at dawn, while the twisted bow section hides gardens of soft coral.

name: Cape Kri
blurb: Dr. Allen famously recorded over 374 species on a single dive here—biodiversity fireworks. Expect ripping currents, patrolling sharks, and kaleidoscopic reefscapes.

name: Fotteyo Kandu
blurb: One of the Maldives’ most famous channels: expect grey reef sharks on patrol, yellow coral overhangs, and morning light flooding the swim-throughs.

name: Tubbataha Wall
blurb: A sheer underwater cliff dropping into bottomless blue. Hammerheads, mantas, and pristine hard-coral spires make this UNESCO reserve a bucket-list must.

name: Poor Knights Islands
blurb: Volcanic arches, cathedral caverns, and a blend of warm-current tropical species with cold-water kelp forests. A dreamy, cinematic dive frontier.

name: Silfra Fissure
blurb: A surreal float between the North American and Eurasian tectonic plates. The visibility is almost supernatural—over 100 meters in glacial meltwater clarity.

name: Orange Canyon
blurb: Towering orange sponges and sheer drop-offs define this Caribbean classic. Turtles, eagle rays, and impossibly blue water complete the picture.

name: Blue Heron Bridge
blurb: The world’s most celebrated muck dive: frogfish, batfish, octopus, juvenile angels, and alien macro critters hiding under every bridge piling.

name: The Boiler
blurb: An offshore seamount famed for intimate manta interactions. Hammerheads shimmer in the blue as dolphins swirl through the bubbles.

name: Darwin Arch
blurb: Shark nirvana. Whale sharks in season, hammerhead walls, silky sharks, and oceanic drama under the iconic (now fallen) stone archway.

name: Pedras Secas
blurb: Intricate volcanic swim-throughs, sea turtles resting in ledges, and sparkling tropical blue water. One of Brazil’s crown jewels.

name: Big Brother
blurb: Remote, exposed, and thrilling—vertical walls, vibrant soft coral, and the chance to meet longimanus and threshers patrolling the blue.

name: The Great White Wall
blurb: A vertical slope blanketed in ghostly white dendronephthya soft corals. When the current hits, it lights up like snowy glitter underwater.

name: Aliwal Shoal
blurb: A fossilized sand dune turned reef, offering ragged-tooth shark aggregations, cathedral swim-throughs, and open-ocean surprises.
